info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 6:25PM EDT until June 15 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
At 625 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated that some streams were still rising within the warned area. Specifically, Buffalo Creek at Murat had increased by about 16 inches over the past 90 minutes and was still rising. While rain was not falling in the warned area currently, additional rainfall, potentially heavy, is possible later this evening.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.
SOURCE...Gauges reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Goshen... Collierstown... Rockbridge Baths... Natural Bridge... Brownsburg...
This includes the following streams and drainages... Allen Creek, Alone Mill Creek, Cabin Creek, Back Creek, Calfpasture River, Broad Creek, Blue Suck Branch, Buffalo Creek, Big Hollow Branch and Alum Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
